quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nba and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Joe Dimaggio was known as The Yankee Clipper and Joltin Joe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Florida State University center became a star NBA player after his pro coach sent him to play in NYCs Rucker Tournament. His unconventional behavior included sleeping on park benches. Who is this former cab driver?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Cowens

questions.question: Gheorghe Mureşan, one of the tallest players to ever play in the NBA, was born in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romania

questions.question: After a great college career at Louisville, this center became the first star for the old Washington Bullets (now the Washington Wizards). He was less than 68 (2 m) tall but was noted for his great rebounding, picks and fabulous outlet passes. Who is this former NBA great?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wes Unseld

questions.question: Whitey Ford is considered the Yankees greatest right-handed pitcher of all time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Wilt The Stilt Chamberlain became the first NBA player who has scored 100 points in a single game. Against which team did he score the 100 points?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New York Knicks

questions.question: Although “only” 67 (2 m) tall he was the first of the great defensive players in the NBA. His college team won the NCAA championship. His pro team won many championships. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Russell

questions.question: Tony Lazzeri starred at shortstop for the 1927 Yankees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This center went in the ABA directly out of high school. He later played 21 seasons in the NBA. He  played on a team with high scorer Rick Barry and later with Barrys son, Jon. Who is this player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moses Malone

questions.question: Which player was the center at UCLA when the Bruins won 88 straight games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Walton

questions.question: Bill Dickey wore number 8 when he played for the New York Yankees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This great center was sometimes called The Howler” because he used to yell at opponents in order to ruin the shooters concentration. His other nickname is associated with his career between college and the NBA. Who is this three-time Olympian who once scored a quadruple double?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Robinson

questions.question: Margo Dydek broke the record for the tallest player to ever play in the WNBA. How tall is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 72 (2.18 m)

questions.question: One of Babe Ruths nicknames was The Bambino.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Born in Lagos, Nigeria in 1963, this player led his team to two consecutive NBA crowns in 1994 and 1995. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hakeem Olajuwon

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Center and Driver
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, atlanta. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 2003, this former football player became head coach at the University of Alabama, replacing Mike Price.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Shula

questions.question: Paul William Bear Bryant coached the University of Alabama football team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who won the Sharpie 500 in Bristol on August 26, 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Kenseth

questions.question: In one of the more controversial wins of 2006 NASCAR, who picked up his first career cup win in Talledega on October 8 in the UAW-Ford 500?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Vickers

questions.question: May 6, 2006 saw a victory for this popular NASCAR driver in the Crown Royal 400 in Richmond.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dale Earnhardt, Jr.

questions.question: Which driver won the Golden Corral 500 on March 20, 2006 in Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kasey Kahne

questions.question: Although originally drafted in the second round as a forward, this man took over the center spot for his only NBA team and led them to an NBA championship. He later coached at Creighton University. Who is this center who was nicknamed The Captain” in the NBA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willis Reed

questions.question: The biggest race of 2006, the Daytona 500, was won by what racer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmie Johnson

questions.question: Only two drivers each got 6 poles in 2006. Kasey Kahne was one. Name the other.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kurt Busch

questions.question: Which driver swept both races at Pocono in 2006, winning also both poles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denny Hamlin

questions.question: Which driver swept both races at Phoenix in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Harvick

questions.question: Did John Heisman coach at Auburn University from 1895 until 1899?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who won the 2006 Pepsi 400 on July 1 and celebrated it by climbing a fence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Stewart

questions.question: In the USG Sheetrock 400, who claimed victory at the Chicagoland raceway in controversial fashion on July 9, 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Gordon

questions.question: After a great college career at Bowling Green, this center played power forward for the Warriors because Wilt Cahmberlain played center. After Wilt was traded back to Philadelphia, he bloomed as a center. Who is this player who once pulled down 18 rebounds in one quarter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nate Thurmond

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Team and Amateur
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, brazil, dallas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A golfer who has done any one of these is no longer considered an amateur.  There is an odd one, however, which would not change your status of an amateur.

options.text: Received a trophey of significant monetary value

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Played along with professional players

questions.question: One of the following statements is incorrect.

options.text: Long shots may reduce the total number of strokes for a given hole.
A frequent result of long shots is that the ball goes out of bounds.
A frequent result of short shots is that the ball comes to rest on difficult ground.
Long shots are less precise than short ones.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A frequent result of short shots is that the ball comes to rest on difficult ground.

questions.question: All manufactured golf clubs are for right-handed golfers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This former linebacker for the Dallas Cowboys played for the University of Alabama from 1960-1962.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee Roy Jordan

questions.question: Who was the head football coach at the University of Alabama after Harold Red Drew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: JB Ears Whitworth

questions.question: In 1992, William Laird Cowher became head coach of the Pittsburgh Steelers, replacing Chuck Noll.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The majors for men are this many in number.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: In 1945 Bryant was named head coach at the University of Maryland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: My real name is Edson Arantes do Nascimento and I scored 77 goals in 92 appearances with my national team. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pele

questions.question: Did American football quarterback Peyton Manning play for the University of Tennessee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: I started playing for the national team of Brazil in 1999 and I joined the Barcelona soccer team in 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronaldhino

questions.question: This former American football player, who played for the Atlanta Falcons and Washington Redskins, won the 1971 Heisman Trophy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Sullivan

questions.question: Is golf always relaxing to play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: There are four major types of golf clubs. Which of the following pairs (club type - common shot) is wrong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lob Wedges - Low shots

questions.question: I played for the national team of West Germany from 1965-1977. I went on to become national team manager and led our team to the World Cup finals in 1990 and 1986. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franz Beckenbauer

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Braves and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, field, ralph. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: I was born crippled and the operation that let me walk left me with a distorted leg. Yet, I managed to win two World Cup titles. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garrincha

questions.question: Dale Murphy was a first round pick of the Atlanta Braves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 2003, I joined the soccer club Real Madrid. Bend it like _______ is a movie title that makes reference to my name. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Beckham

questions.question: Warren Spahn was elected to the Hall of Fame by the Baseball Writers in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ralph Garr never won a batting title while playing with the Braves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Phil Niekro was famous for throwing a knuckle ball pitch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Steve Avery played Center Field for the Braves during his career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: I have a move named after me and I was born on April 25, 1947. I played for the Ajax Juniors at 10. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johan Cruyff

questions.question: Eddie Mathews is the first Brave to play in Boston, Milwaukee, and Atlanta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: I played for the French national team but I was ejected from the 2006 World Cup Final for headbutting an Italian player. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zinedine Zidane

questions.question: In 1990 I was sold to Juventus for £7,700,000. Not to mention I scored 24 goals in 40 games with Fiorentina. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberto Baggio

questions.question: I was born on October 30th 1960 and in 1982 I was transferred to Barcelona for a record £5.000.000 as a transfer fee. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diego Maradona

questions.question: Tommie Aaron, who is Hank Aarons brother, played for the Braves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1965, I became the first British soccer player to be knighted. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stanley Matthews

questions.question: Hank Aaron wore uniform number 3 while he was a Braves player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nfl and Hulk Hogan
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, network, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Each year the NFL gives an award for kickers which is named after this former NFL great.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Groza

questions.question: Saturday Nights Main Event aired on what network during the 80s and early 90s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC

questions.question: What former tag team partner of Tony Atlas inducted him into the WWE Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: S.D. Jones

questions.question: Hulk Hogan once defended his WWF title on Saturday Nights Main Event against King Harley Race.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This great kicker was a Danish soccer star as a teenager. He was a visiting high school student  in Indianapolis when he kicked a field goal, just to try it. This led to a scholarship to Michigan State and a  fine Pro career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morten Andersen

questions.question: The three machines, introduced by Lou Albano in the mid-80s, featured three masked superstars. They were Axe, Andre the Giant, and who else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackjack Mulligan

questions.question: This Kentucky grad had a very long Pro Football career. He won games as a kicker and as a  quarterback. He originally played for the Chicago bears but also won fame playing for the Houston Oilers and the Oakland Raiders.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Blanda

questions.question: Unlike most NFL players, this great kicker was born in Fenstud, Norway. In Super Bowl IV, he kicked three field goals. Who was this soccer-style kicker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jan Stenerud

questions.question: The face (good guy) team in the main event of the 1988 Survivor Series consisted of Hulk Hogan, Randy Savage, Hillbilly Jim, Hercules, and what other wrestler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Koko B. Ware

questions.question: In what city did Andre the Giant defeat Hulk Hogan for the WWF title?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indianapolis

questions.question: Felipe Rojas Alou played with the Braves during his entire career  .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Johnny Logan was traded by the Milwaukee Braves to the Pittsburgh Pirates for Gino Cimoli on June 15, 1961.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: For many years NFL placekickers would line-up directly in front of where the ball was placed. This  changed when soccer style placekickers entered the league. These two Hungarian-born brothers were the most significant of the early placekickers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gogolaks

questions.question: This placekicker started his career in 1982 with the New Orleans Saints. He was 46 when he re-signed with the Atlanta Falcons in 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morten Andersen

questions.question: Who did professional wrestler Roddy Piper not face on Saturday Nights Main Event in 1985 and 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. T

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Real and Istanbul
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, college, crisp. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Priest Holmes and Deacon Jones are both the actual names of two NFL stars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Wilton was Stilt Chamberlains real first name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sanford was the real first name of Hall-of-Fame pitcher Koufax.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tug McGraw was the actual name of an all-star pitcher with the Mets and Phillies who died of brain cancer in 2004 at age of 60.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Peerless Price is the given name of a wide receiver, famous for playing for the Buffalo Bills.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Coco Crisp is the real name of a Boston Red Sox center-fielder.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This famous player from South Dakota is the first placekicker to win four NFL championships.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Vinatieri

questions.question: This quarterback played his college ball at Louisville and his pro ball for Philadelphia. In a game  against the Bears, he scored 15 points.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Akers

questions.question: Mildred Ella Zaharias was a golfer and world-class female athlete whose nickname was Babe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Weeb Ewbank was the actual name of a famous American professional football coach.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Monsanto Pope is the real name of a football player drafted by the Denver Broncos in 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: As most NFL fans know, this kicker was born without toes on his right foot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Dempsey

questions.question: Which of the following soccer teams is not from Cyprus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kerkira

questions.question: Pele is the real name of the former Brazilian football player who won three World Cup medals.

questions.question: Istanbul is the home city of the most powerful Turkish soccer teams. Which of the following teams is not based in Istanbul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genclerbirligi SK
